meanings.definition: A person who has recently risen to a higher social or economic class, especially through unscrupulous or ambitious behavior.
meanings.sent1: The upstarts at the party were trying to impress everyone with their expensive clothes.
meanings.sent2: The upstarts in the company quickly gained influence with their bold ideas.
meanings.sent3: The upstarts in the neighborhood caused a stir by throwing a lavish party.
meanings.sent4: The upstarts in the business world shook things up with their innovative strategies.
meanings.sent5: The upstarts' sudden success surprised everyone in the community.

meanings.definition: To rise suddenly in rank or status.
meanings.sent1: She upstarts in the company after her hard work was recognized by the boss.
meanings.sent2: The team upstarts to the top of the leaderboard with their exceptional performance.
meanings.sent3: The plant upstarts towards the sunlight to ensure it gets enough energy.
meanings.sent4: His popularity upstarts after his viral video reaches millions of views.
meanings.sent5: The rocket upstarts into the sky, leaving a trail of smoke behind.
